newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government bonds lower on interbank rate.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government bonds lower on interbank rate.

text.p: Singapore government bonds closed lower in moderate trade on retail and interbank interest, dealers said on Tuesday.
"Bonds prices were marked down slightly today following an easing in the interbank rate. Treasury bill yields were slightly lower and volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$99.17/99.22 compared with Monday's close of S$99.10/99.20, September 2001 at S$97.38/97.43 against S$96.70/96.75 and June 2003 at S$95.38/95.43 from S$94.70/94.75.
The overnight interbank offered rate eased to 3-1/4 3-1/8 versus Monday's 3-3/4 3-5/8 percent.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 0.93/0.88 percent against Monday's yield of 1.30/1.25 percent and one-year at a yield of 1.48/1.43 from 1.85/1.80 percent.
